Posts.Content: Jan 13, 2009 01:01PM MelissaA wrote: Hey Lindasa. I know what you mean about being a "worrier from way back." That describes me well. I wish I could just "turn it off" but I can't. My husband and his sister say its like an "easy button." They can flip that switch off and on - if they decide to not worry - they actually don't. I even worry about THEM!!! Not worrying!!!! LOL I'm waiting to have an excisional biopsy January 22. I'm just trying to arm myself with as much knowledge as I can beforehand. I know some people don't believe that way, but I want to know what it means. If the doctor says "benign" - I know what that means. But if she says something else - I want to know what that means too. So I can be as prepared as possible and ask the right questions. Since I'm a worrier too, I don't have any suggestions for ya. Just thought I'd let you know you're not alone in it. TAke care of yourself.

Posts.Content: Jan 14, 2009 09:42AM MelissaA wrote: Hey javagirl39. I'm assuming your name is a reference to coffee?? I'm right there with you!!  I'm so sorry for you what you're going through. I know you are just scared to death. Its a hard feeling to describe to others, isn't it? I'm 38, awaiting biopsy on January 22 for lump in by right breast. What kind of biposy did you have? I'm scheduled for an excisional, outpatient surgery, IV anesthesia. Did the "looks quite suspicous" comment come from the biopsy itself, or your mammogram? Do you have supportive people in your life? Friends, family? I've chosen not to tell anyone until the bipsy is over, except my husband and best friend. Let us know how things are going. I'm sending prayers and good thoughts your way. Feel free to message me or email. Melissa
Posts.Title: waiting for biopsy results javagirl39 Artemis

Posts.Content: Jan 11, 2009 04:34AM MelissaA wrote: Hi Eve. First off - do not be scared to see a doctor. As for money, does you college have a student health center? Perhaps you could start there. Is it just pain, or do you feel lumps/bumps/masses, etc? Is the pain there all the time when you push on it, or just at certain times of the month?? (Like before, during or after your period). Is the pain new? Breast pain/tenderness can come from lots of different things.

How soon after your biopsy will you know something. Glad you have the Zanax. Keep posting and remember that they say 80% of all breast biopsies are benign. Hugs and prayers, Melissa
Posts.Title: Just starting and very worried Tina-in-Seattle Lizann22

Posts.Content: Jan 23, 2009 06:24AM MelissaA wrote: Hi Jenn - yes, you do need to get it checked. However, there are other things that minic cancer - cysts and fibroadenomas, to name two. Breast cancer is very rare in a woman as young as you, so try to not worry too much - but get an appointment with your doctor as soon as you can to make sure. Cysts often change (appear, disappear, shrink, grow) with your period. I've read that fibroadenomas are often effected by hormonal changes as well. Its great that you are already so in tune with your body and taking care of yourself so well!! Take care of yourself and let us know if you need anything.
Posts.Title: Cancer? Jenn8907 mommy2baz

Posts.Content: Jan 26, 2009 12:48PM MelissaA wrote: Hey Kelly - Thanks for the nice words. I am going to call at 3:00, but there seemed to be some confusion wthi the recovery room nurses. I'm pretty sure the surgeon is not going to give me the results until I see her on Thursday. It was the recovery room nurse who told me to call today for the results. So......I'm going to call and ask. My breast surgeon has a great assistant and phone calls go to her, so she should be able to clear it up. When do you get your results?? Moosey and Jodi W - Will be thinking of you both this week with your biopsies. Mine was an excisional biopsy - no wire localization as it was a palpable lump - and I didn't have any problems at all. virtually no pain afterwards, just a littel sore. Felt a little sluggish that day and most of the next, but I guess that was from the IV sedation - or the stress! I know you both will do fine and I'm praying for you and wishing you benign results! Love and prayers, Melissa
